newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Vets make slow progress on BSE sheep tissue proposal.
newsitem.headline: Vets make slow progress on BSE sheep tissue proposal.

text.p: The European Union's Standing Veterinary Committee made slow progress on Friday on a new Commission proposal to remove suspect tissue from sheep, goats and cattle, a Commission official said.
The proposal is a precautionary move following British and French research showing that sheep could catch mad cow disease, or Bovine Spongiform Encephalopathy (BSE), fuelling public health fears.
"Talks could run late into the evening," the official said, noting that the committee had since the morning reached the third of seven articles in the proposal.
"There's a lot of opposition on different points," said the official, adding it was unclear whether the proposal would be put to a vote on Friday.
Ten member states oppose the move, mostly because they say it is economically unjustified in view of the negligeable risk involved.
Only Britain, France and Ireland previously expressed any support for the proposal, based on advice from the Scientific Veterinary Committee. Denmark and Portugal have shown partial support.
If there is no qualified majority in support of the proposal it will be sent to the Farm Council in December.
